.definition: to mention something in order to give somebody information about it or make them notice it
.example: Here we'll point out the obvious.

.definition: to try to find or get something, especially something that is not a physical object
.example: She always seeks to do good in the world

.definition: until now; up to this point
.example: Any questions so far?

.definition: to consider somebody/something when you are doing or planning something
.example: I’m thinking about changing careers.

.definition: to spend time producing or improving something
.example: That kid needs to work on his attitude.

.definition: to be under power; affected by or possibly affected by (something).
.example: All baggage is subject to inspection.

.definition: only if
.example: You can have a dog as long as you promise to take care of it.

.definition: are able to, to deal with
.example: Did you manage to get in touch at all?

.definition: used to say what something means or to give more information
.example: We're coming next month, that is to say, in November.

.definition: to be formed from the things or people mentioned
.example: What does it consist of?

.definition: it is the indication of the effect due to a cause
.example: He was tired and as a result not very aware.

.definition: in the place of somebody/something
.example: He can go instead of me.

.definition: used when you want to mention another person or thing after something else
.example: The house was well located in addition.

.definition: to discover a fact or piece of information
.example: Helen's friend told her a lie but Helen found out the truth.

.definition: used when you are explaining something
.example: And the problem you see is with awareness-raising.

.definition: to end in; to make something happen
.example: That would result in complaints.

.definition: continuing a long time into the future
.example: It seems to work, but what of the long term effects?

.definition: except for
.example: Are there any others, apart from him?

.definition: when, just after (something happens)
.example: Please call me as soon as dinner is ready.

.definition: despite everything; when everything has been considered; the fact is
.example: You'd better invite Edd to your party. After all, he's a good friend.

.definition: to return to a place,  to start to happen or exist again
.example: She will come back to the kitchen with a bottle of fancy wine.

.definition: more than one but indefinitely small in number
.example: They need a couple of minutes still.

.definition: used to say that you agree
.example: If it’s all right I think I’ll head off to bed.

.definition: for example
.example: That holds true for even the governor for instance.

.definition: to experience or suffer something
.example: We had many trials to go through

.definition: specifically or especially distinguished from others
.example: In particular, the supply curve for a particular product will increasingly more inelastic over a period of time.

.definition: used to refer to the second of two things or people mentioned
.example: Tom and Dick were both heroes but only the latter is remembered today

.definition: to look and/or take action to be certain that something happens, is true, etc.
.example: Make sure you’re home by midnight.

.definition: used for introducing a fact
.example: "I'm still going out even though it may rain."

.definition: more, extra, or additional; comparative offar
.example: Not only did I arrive at my conclusions after careful thought, I took a further step and tested them.

.definition: used to show when it is necessary or would be a good thing to perform the activity referred to by the following verb
.example: We ought not/oughtn't to have agreed without knowing what it would cost.

.definition: used to indicate a different opinion or point of view
.example: Skydiving looks fun but on the other hand, it seems dangerous.

.definition: Gain control, management, or possession of  something/ someone (task, job, political party, organisation)
.example: After 11 hours of driving, I was getting tired. Fortunately, my friend offered to take over.

.definition: The evening or night immediately before the present.
.example: I had so much fun last night.

.definition: excessively
.example: I don’t worry about it too much.

.definition: To seem; appear
.example: We need to ask ourselves what success would look like.

.definition: to demand that something happens
.example: Hard times call for tough measures.

.definition: approximately or a little more than
.example: I'll be with you in a minute or two.

.definition: If something comes out, it becomes known publicly after it has been kept secret
.example: The news will come out that he will leave the team.

.definition: believed to be something that should happen or be done.
.example: They can’t be expected to just sit there and wait.

.definition: a set of different things of the same general type.
.example: Eventually, a range of events changed that.

.definition: at a particular moment or period in the past when something happened, especially when the situation is very different now
.example: I was busy at the time.

.definition: Without the assistance or support of, or dependence upon, anybody else.
.example: I don't need anyone's pity or help, I can make it all on my own, thank you very much.

.definition: concerning; related to
.example: I think it has something to do with physics.

.definition: be announced, published, or sent out to people.
.example: Brochures go out to prospective buyers.

.definition: a large amount, very much
.example: She means a great deal to me.

.definition: in the course of a journey
.example: We can stop for lunch on the way.

.definition: at the present time; now
.example: They have a lot going on at the moment.

.definition: used to describe how a situation seems to be
.example: I felt as though I'd been lying in the sun for hours.
